page.title: 09BISHOP BURTON VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: Bishop Burton has a small{Church of {England school}which has at the present{18 children enrolled.} It is run by its {2 teachers and 6 {ancillary}staff. There has been a school in the village since the end of the nineteenth century but the Humberside Education Committee is now seeking to close the institution because of declining numbers. It was due to close in July 1985 but an action group of parents was set up and travelled to Parliament to make their protest heard. This caused the Government to grant the school a one year reprieve and the situation is to be reviewed in July 1986. In the past the school has been a focal point for the village but today has declining importance. There is no Secondary School in Bishop Burton, the nearest being in Beverley.
